types.name: Sample
types.description: The identifiers and metadata associated with a physical piece of biological material collected from the field for external analysis. A Sample can take many forms (leaf clipping, seed, DNA, etc) and might be used for a variety of analysis procedures (spectra, genotyping, etc).

fields.name: additionalInfo
fields.description: A free space containing any additional information related to a particular object. A data source may provide any JSON object, unrestricted by the BrAPI specification.

fields.name: column
fields.description: The Column identifier for this `Sample` location in the `Plate`

fields.name: externalReferences
fields.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

fields.name: germplasmDbIds
fields.description: The ID which uniquely identifies a `Germplasm`

fields.name: observationUnitDbIds
fields.description: The ID which uniquely identifies an `ObservationUnit`

fields.name: plateDbIds
fields.description: The ID which uniquely identifies a `Plate` of `Sample`

fields.name: programDbIds
fields.description: The ID which uniquely identifies a `Program` within the given database server

fields.name: row
fields.description: The Row identifier for this `Sample` location in the `Plate`

fields.name: sampleBarcode
fields.description: A unique identifier physically attached to the `Sample`

fields.name: sampleDescription
fields.description:
Description of a `Sample`
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-79) Sample description - Any information not captured by the other sample fields, including quantification, sample treatments and processing.

fields.name: sampleDbId
fields.description:
The ID which uniquely identifies a `Sample`
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-76) Sample ID - Unique identifier for the sample.

fields.name: sampleGroupId
fields.description: The ID which uniquely identifies a group of `Samples`

fields.name: sampleName
fields.description: The human readable name of the `Sample`

fields.name: samplePUI
fields.description:
A permanent unique identifier for the `Sample` (DOI, URL, UUID, etc)
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-81) External ID - An identifier for the sample in a persistent repository, comprising the name of the repository and the accession number of the observation unit therein. Submission to the EBI Biosamples repository is recommended. URI are recommended when possible.

fields.name: sampleTimestamp
fields.description:
The date and time a `Sample` was collected from the field
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-80) Collection date - The date and time when the sample was collected / harvested

fields.name: sampleType
fields.description: The type of `Sample` taken. ex. 'DNA', 'RNA', 'Tissue', etc

fields.name: studyDbIds
fields.description: The ID which uniquely identifies a `Study` within the given database server

fields.name: takenBy
fields.description: The name or identifier of the entity which took the `Sample` from the field

fields.name: tissueType
fields.description:
The type of tissue sampled. ex. 'Leaf', 'Root', etc.
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-78) Plant anatomical entity - A description of the plant part (e.g. leaf) or the plant product (e.g. resin) from which the sample was taken, in the form of an accession number to a suitable controlled vocabulary (Plant Ontology).

fields.name: trialDbIds
fields.description: The ID which uniquely identifies a `Trial` within the given database server

fields.name: well
fields.description: The Well identifier for this `Sample` location in the `Plate`. Usually a concatenation of Row and Column, or just a number if the `Samples` are not part of an ordered `Plate`.

types.name: Scale
types.description:
A Scale describes the units and acceptable values for an ObservationVariable.
For example, an ObservationVariable might be defined with a Trait of "plant height", a Scale of "meters", and a Method of "tape measure". This variable would be distinct from a variable with the Scale "inches" or "pixels".

fields.name: additionalInfo
fields.description: A free space containing any additional information related to a particular object. A data source may provide any JSON object, unrestricted by the BrAPI specification.

fields.name: dataType
fields.description:
Class of the scale, entries can be

"Code" - This scale class is exceptionally used to express complex traits. Code is a nominal scale that combines the expressions of the different traits composing the complex trait. For example a severity trait might be expressed by a 2 digit and 2 character code. The first 2 digits are the percentage of the plant covered by a fungus and the 2 characters refer to the delay in development, e.g. "75VD" means "75 %" of the plant is infected and the plant is very delayed.

"Date" - The date class is for events expressed in a time format, See ISO 8601

"Duration" - The Duration class is for time elapsed between two events expressed in a time format, e.g. days, hours, months

"Nominal" - Categorical scale that can take one of a limited and fixed number of categories. There is no intrinsic ordering to the categories

"Numerical" - Numerical scales express the trait with real numbers. The numerical scale defines the unit e.g. centimeter, ton per hectare, branches

"Ordinal" - Ordinal scales are scales composed of ordered categories

"Text" - A free text is used to express the trait.

fields.name: decimalPlaces
fields.description: For numerical, number of decimal places to be reported

fields.name: externalReferences
fields.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

fields.name: ontologyReference
fields.description:
MIAPPE V1.1

(DM-85) Variable accession number - Accession number of the variable in the Crop Ontology

(DM-87) Trait accession number - Accession number of the trait in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology, Trait Ontology).

(DM-89) Method accession number - Accession number of the method in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology, Trait Ontology).

(DM-93) Scale accession number - Accession number of the scale in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology).

fields.name: scaleDbId
fields.description: Unique identifier of the scale. If left blank, the upload system will automatically generate a scale ID.

fields.name: scaleName
fields.description:
Name of the scale
MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-92) Scale Name of the scale associated with the variable

fields.name: scalePUI
fields.description: The Permanent Unique Identifier of a Scale, usually in the form of a URI

fields.name: units
fields.description:
This field can be used to describe the units used for this scale. This should be the abbreviated 
form of the units, intended to be displayed with every value using this scale. Usually this only 
applies when `dataType` is Numeric, but could also be included for other dataTypes when applicable.

types.name: ScaleInput
types.description:
A Scale describes the units and acceptable values for an ObservationVariable.
For example, an ObservationVariable might be defined with a Trait of "plant height", a Scale of "meters", and a Method of "tape measure". This variable would be distinct from a variable with the Scale "inches" or "pixels".

inputFields.name: additionalInfo
inputFields.description: A free space containing any additional information related to a particular object. A data source may provide any JSON object, unrestricted by the BrAPI specification.

inputFields.name: dataType
inputFields.description:
Class of the scale, entries can be

"Code" - This scale class is exceptionally used to express complex traits. Code is a nominal scale that combines the expressions of the different traits composing the complex trait. For example a severity trait might be expressed by a 2 digit and 2 character code. The first 2 digits are the percentage of the plant covered by a fungus and the 2 characters refer to the delay in development, e.g. "75VD" means "75 %" of the plant is infected and the plant is very delayed.

"Date" - The date class is for events expressed in a time format, See ISO 8601

"Duration" - The Duration class is for time elapsed between two events expressed in a time format, e.g. days, hours, months

"Nominal" - Categorical scale that can take one of a limited and fixed number of categories. There is no intrinsic ordering to the categories

"Numerical" - Numerical scales express the trait with real numbers. The numerical scale defines the unit e.g. centimeter, ton per hectare, branches

"Ordinal" - Ordinal scales are scales composed of ordered categories

"Text" - A free text is used to express the trait.

inputFields.name: decimalPlaces
inputFields.description: For numerical, number of decimal places to be reported

inputFields.description: Filter by External References

inputFields.name: ontologyReference
inputFields.description:
MIAPPE V1.1

(DM-85) Variable accession number - Accession number of the variable in the Crop Ontology

(DM-87) Trait accession number - Accession number of the trait in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology, Trait Ontology).

(DM-89) Method accession number - Accession number of the method in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology, Trait Ontology).

(DM-93) Scale accession number - Accession number of the scale in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology).

types.name: Season
types.description: A Season defines a period in time. A Season is made of two parts; (1) the primary year and (2) a term which defines a segment of the year. This term could be a traditional season, like "Spring" or "Summer", or this term could be a month, like "May" or "June", or this could be an arbitrary season name which is meaningful to the breeding Program like "PlantingTime_3" or "Season E".

fields.name: seasonDbId
fields.description: The ID which uniquely identifies a season. For backward compatibility it can be a string like '2012', '1957-2004'

fields.name: seasonName
fields.description: Name of the season. ex. 'Spring', 'Q2', 'Season A', etc.

fields.name: year
fields.description: The 4 digit year of the season.

types.name: SeedLot
types.description: A SeedLot, also known as an InventoryLot, is a collection of starting material (seeds, bulbs, root-stock, etc) for a particular Germplasm. The amount of material available for each Germplasm can be increased by seed production and decreased by planting or trading with another breeding Program.

fields.name: additionalInfo
fields.description: A free space containing any additional information related to a particular object. A data source may provide any JSON object, unrestricted by the BrAPI specification.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The current balance of the amount of material in a SeedLot. Could be a count (seeds, bulbs, etc) or a weight (kg of seed).

fields.name: contentMixture
fields.description:
The mixture of germplasm present in the seed lot.
If this seed lot only contains a single germplasm, the response should contain the name and DbId of that germplasm with a mixturePercentage value of 100
If the seed lot contains a mixture of different germplasm, the response should contain the name and DbId every germplasm present. The mixturePercentage field should contain the ratio of each germplasm in the total mixture. All of the mixturePercentage values in this array should sum to equal 100.

fields.name: createdDate
fields.description: The time stamp for when this seed lot was created

fields.name: externalReferences
fields.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

fields.description:

20) Field collection

99) Other (elaborate in REMARKS field)

types.name: Study
types.description: A Study represents an experiment that has taken place at a single location. The Study contains metadata about the parameters and design of the experiment. It can also be used to group results and data sets generated from the experiment. A Trial can represent a collection of one or more Studies.

fields.name: active

fields.description: MIAPPE V1.1 (DM-28) Cultural practices - General description of the cultural practices of the study.

fields.description: List of links to extra data files associated with this study. Extra data could include notes, images, and reference data.

fields.description: A URL to the human readable documentation of an object

fields.description:

fields.description:
Environmental parameters that were kept constant throughout the study and did not change between observation units.

fields.description: The usage license associated with the study data

fields.description: Observation levels indicate the granularity level at which the measurements are taken. `levelName` defines the level, `levelOrder` defines where that level exists in the hierarchy of levels. `levelOrder`s lower numbers are at the top of the hierarchy (ie field > 0) and higher numbers are at the bottom of the hierarchy (ie plant > 6). **Standard Level Names: study, field, entry, rep, block, sub-block, plot, sub-plot, plant, pot, sample** For more information on Observation Levels, please review the Observation Levels documentation.

types.name: Trait
types.description:
A Trait describes what property is being observed.
For example, an ObservationVariable might be defined with a Trait of "plant height", a Scale of "meters", and a Method of "tape measure". This variable would be distinct from a variable with the Trait "Leaf length" or "Flower height".

fields.name: additionalInfo
fields.description: A free space containing any additional information related to a particular object. A data source may provide any JSON object, unrestricted by the BrAPI specification.

fields.name: alternativeAbbreviations
fields.description: A list of shortened, human readable, names for a Trait. These abbreviations are acceptable alternatives to the mainAbbreviation and do not need to follow any formatting convention.

fields.name: attribute
fields.description: A trait can be decomposed as "Trait" = "Entity" + "Attribute", the attribute is the observed feature (or characteristic) of the entity e.g., for "grain colour", attribute = "colour"

fields.name: attributePUI
fields.description:
The Permanent Unique Identifier of a Trait Attribute, usually in the form of a URI
A trait can be decomposed as "Trait" = "Entity" + "Attribute", the attribute is the observed feature (or characteristic) of the entity e.g., for "grain colour", attribute = "colour"

fields.name: entity
fields.description: A trait can be decomposed as "Trait" = "Entity" + "Attribute", the entity is the part of the plant that the trait refers to e.g., for "grain colour", entity = "grain"

fields.name: entityPUI
fields.description:
The Permanent Unique Identifier of a Trait Entity, usually in the form of a URI
A Trait can be decomposed as "Trait" = "Entity" + "Attribute", the Entity is the part of the plant that the trait refers to e.g., for "grain colour", entity = "grain"

fields.name: externalReferences
fields.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

fields.name: mainAbbreviation
fields.description: A shortened version of the human readable name for a Trait

(DM-87) Trait accession number - Accession number of the trait in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology, Trait Ontology).

(DM-89) Method accession number - Accession number of the method in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology, Trait Ontology).

(DM-93) Scale accession number - Accession number of the scale in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology).

types.name: TraitDataType
types.description:
Class of the scale, entries can be

"Code" - This scale class is exceptionally used to express complex traits. Code is a nominal scale that combines the expressions of the different traits composing the complex trait. For example a severity trait might be expressed by a 2 digit and 2 character code. The first 2 digits are the percentage of the plant covered by a fungus and the 2 characters refer to the delay in development, e.g. "75VD" means "75 %" of the plant is infected and the plant is very delayed.

"Date" - The date class is for events expressed in a time format, See ISO 8601

"Duration" - The Duration class is for time elapsed between two events expressed in a time format, e.g. days, hours, months

"Nominal" - Categorical scale that can take one of a limited and fixed number of categories. There is no intrinsic ordering to the categories

"Numerical" - Numerical scales express the trait with real numbers. The numerical scale defines the unit e.g. centimeter, ton per hectare, branches

"Ordinal" - Ordinal scales are scales composed of ordered categories

"Text" - A free text is used to express the trait.

inputFields.name: commonCropNames
inputFields.description:
The BrAPI Common Crop Name is the simple, generalized, widely accepted name of the organism being researched. It is most often used in multi-crop systems where digital resources need to be divided at a high level. Things like 'Maize', 'Wheat', and 'Rice' are examples of common crop names.

Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given crops. 

Use `GET /commoncropnames` to find the list of available crops on a server.

inputFields.description:
The unique identifier for an ontology definition. Use this parameter to filter results based on a specific ontology 

  Use `GET /ontologies` to find the list of available ontologies on a server.

inputFields.name: programDbIds
inputFields.description:
A BrAPI Program represents the high level organization or group who is responsible for conducting trials and studies. Things like Breeding Programs and Funded Projects are considered BrAPI Programs. 

Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given programs. 

Use `GET /programs` to find the list of available programs on a server.

inputFields.name: programNames
inputFields.description:
Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given program names. Program names are not required to be unique.

Use `GET /programs` to find the list of available programs on a server.

inputFields.name: searchDateRangeStart
inputFields.description:
The start of the overlapping search date range. `searchDateRangeStart` must be before `searchDateRangeEnd`.

Return a Trial entity if any of the following cases are true

- `searchDateRangeStart` is before `trial.endDate` AND `searchDateRangeEnd` is null 

- `searchDateRangeStart` is before `trial.endDate` AND `searchDateRangeEnd` is after `trial.startDate`

- `searchDateRangeEnd` is after `trial.startDate` AND `searchDateRangeStart` is null

- `searchDateRangeEnd` is after `trial.startDate` AND `searchDateRangeStart` is before `trial.endDate`

inputFields.name: searchDateRangeEnd
inputFields.description:
The end of the overlapping search date range. `searchDateRangeStart` must be before `searchDateRangeEnd`.

Return a Trial entity if any of the following cases are true

- `searchDateRangeStart` is before `trial.endDate` AND `searchDateRangeEnd` is null 

- `searchDateRangeStart` is before `trial.endDate` AND `searchDateRangeEnd` is after `trial.startDate`

- `searchDateRangeEnd` is after `trial.startDate` AND `searchDateRangeStart` is null

- `searchDateRangeEnd` is after `trial.startDate` AND `searchDateRangeStart` is before `trial.endDate`

types.name: Variable
types.description: A unique combination of Trait, Method, and Scale to define a clear context for an Observation.

fields.name: additionalInfo
fields.description: A free space containing any additional information related to a particular object. A data source may provide any JSON object, unrestricted by the BrAPI specification.

fields.name: commonCropName
fields.description: Crop name (examples: "Maize", "Wheat")

fields.name: contextOfUse
fields.description: Indication of how trait is routinely used. (examples: ["Trial evaluation", "Nursery evaluation"])

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: Variable default value. (examples: "red", "2.3", etc.)

fields.name: documentationURL
fields.description: A URL to the human readable documentation of an object

fields.name: externalReferences
fields.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

fields.name: growthStage
fields.description: Growth stage at which measurement is made (examples: "flowering")

fields.name: institution
fields.description: Name of institution submitting the variable

fields.name: language
fields.description: 2 letter ISO 639-1 code for the language of submission of the variable.

fields.name: methodDbIds
fields.description:
A description of the way an Observation should be collected.
For example, an ObservationVariable might be defined with a Trait of "plant height", a Scale of "meters", and a Method of "tape measure". This variable would be distinct from a variable with the Method "estimation" or "drone image processing".

fields.name: ontologyReference
fields.description:
MIAPPE V1.1

(DM-85) Variable accession number - Accession number of the variable in the Crop Ontology

(DM-87) Trait accession number - Accession number of the trait in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology, Trait Ontology).

(DM-89) Method accession number - Accession number of the method in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology, Trait Ontology).

(DM-93) Scale accession number - Accession number of the scale in a suitable controlled vocabulary (Crop Ontology).

fields.name: scaleDbIds
fields.description:
A Scale describes the units and acceptable values for an ObservationVariable.
For example, an ObservationVariable might be defined with a Trait of "plant height", a Scale of "meters", and a Method of "tape measure". This variable would be distinct from a variable with the Scale "inches" or "pixels".

fields.name: scientist
fields.description: Name of scientist submitting the variable.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Variable status. (examples: "recommended", "obsolete", "legacy", etc.)

fields.name: submissionTimestamp
fields.description: Timestamp when the Variable was added (ISO 8601)

fields.name: synonyms
fields.description: Other variable names

fields.name: traitDbIds
fields.description:
A Trait describes what property is being observed.
For example, an ObservationVariable might be defined with a Trait of "plant height", a Scale of "meters", and a Method of "tape measure". This variable would be distinct from a variable with the Trait "Leaf length" or "Flower height".

types.name: Variant
types.description: A `Variant` represents a change in DNA sequence relative to some reference. For example, a variant could represent a classic marker, a SNP, or an insertion. This is equivalent to a row in VCF.

fields.name: additionalInfo
fields.description: A free space containing any additional information related to a particular object. A data source may provide any JSON object, unrestricted by the BrAPI specification.

fields.name: markerPositionDbId
fields.description: markerPositions

fields.name: analysis
fields.description: Set of Analysis descriptors for this VariantSet

fields.name: ciend
fields.description: Similar to "cipos", but for the variant's end position (which is derived from start + svlen).

fields.name: cipos
fields.description:
In the case of structural variants, start and end of the variant may not
be known with an exact base position. "cipos" provides an interval with
high confidence for the start position. The interval is provided by 0 or
2 signed integers which are added to the start position.
Based on the use in VCF v4.2

fields.name: created
fields.description: The timestamp when this variant was created.

fields.name: end
fields.description:
This field is optional and may be ignored if there is no relevant map or reference to be associated with.
The end position (exclusive), resulting in [start, end) closed-open interval. This is typically calculated by `start + referenceBases.length`.

fields.name: externalReferences
fields.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

fields.name: filtersApplied
fields.description: True if filters were applied for this variant. VCF column 7 "FILTER" any value other than the missing value.

fields.name: filtersFailed
fields.description: Zero or more filters that failed for this variant. VCF column 7 "FILTER" shared across all alleles in the same VCF record.

fields.name: filtersPassed
fields.description: True if all filters for this variant passed. VCF column 7 "FILTER" value PASS.

fields.name: referenceDbIds
fields.description: The unique identifier for a Reference

fields.name: referenceBases
fields.description: The reference bases for this variant. They start at the given start position.

fields.name: referenceSetDbIds
fields.description: The unique identifier for a ReferenceSet

fields.name: start
fields.description:
This field is optional and may be ignored if there is no relevant map or reference to be associated with.
The start position at which this variant occurs (0-based). This corresponds to the first base of the string of reference bases. Genomic positions are non-negative integers less than reference length. Variants spanning the join of circular genomes are represented as two variants one on each side of the join (position 0).

fields.name: svlen
fields.description: Length of the - if labeled as such in variant_type - structural variation. Based on the use in VCF v4.2

fields.name: updated
fields.description: The time at which this variant was last updated.

fields.name: variantDbId
fields.description: The ID which uniquely identifies a `Variant`

fields.name: variantNames
fields.description: A human readable name associated with a `Variant`

fields.name: variantSetDbIds
fields.description: An array of `VariantSet` IDs this variant belongs to. This also defines the `ReferenceSet` against which the `Variant` is to be interpreted.

fields.name: variantType
fields.description:
The "variant_type" is used to denote e.g. structural variants.
Examples:
  DUP  : duplication of sequence following "start"
  DEL  : deletion of sequence following "start"

The start position at which this variant occurs (0-based). This corresponds to the first base of the string of reference bases. Genomic positions are non-negative integers less than reference length. Variants spanning the join of circular genomes are represented as two variants one on each side of the join (position 0).

inputFields.name: svlen
inputFields.description: Length of the - if labeled as such in variant_type - structural variation. Based on the use in VCF v4.2

inputFields.name: updated
inputFields.description: The time at which this variant was last updated.

inputFields.name: variantDbId
inputFields.description: The ID which uniquely identifies a `Variant`

inputFields.name: variantNames
inputFields.description: A human readable name associated with a `Variant`

inputFields.name: variantSet
inputFields.description: An array of `VariantSet` IDs this variant belongs to. This also defines the `ReferenceSet` against which the `Variant` is to be interpreted.

inputFields.name: variantType
inputFields.description:
The "variant_type" is used to denote e.g. structural variants.
Examples:
  DUP  : duplication of sequence following "start"
  DEL  : deletion of sequence following "start"

types.name: VariantSet
types.description: A VariantSet is a collection of variants and variant calls intended to be analyzed together.

fields.name: additionalInfo
fields.description: A free space containing any additional information related to a particular object. A data source may provide any JSON object, unrestricted by the BrAPI specification.

fields.name: analysis
fields.description: Set of Analysis descriptors for this VariantSet

fields.name: availableFormats
fields.description:
When the data for a VariantSet is retrieved, it can be retrieved in a variety of data formats and file formats.
'dataFormat' defines the structure of the data within a file (ie DartSeq, VCF, Hapmap, tabular, etc)
'fileFormat' defines the MIME type of the file (ie text/csv, application/excel, application/zip). This should also be reflected in the Accept and ContentType HTTP headers for every relevant request and response.

fields.name: callSetCount
fields.description: The number of CallSets included in this VariantSet

fields.name: externalReferences
fields.description: An array of external reference ids. These are references to this piece of data in an external system. Could be a simple string or a URI.

fields.name: metadataFields
fields.description:
The 'metadataField' indicates which types of genotyping data and metadata are available in the VariantSet.
When possible, these field names and abbreviations should follow the VCF standard

inputFields.name: commonCropNames
inputFields.description:
The BrAPI Common Crop Name is the simple, generalized, widely accepted name of the organism being researched. It is most often used in multi-crop systems where digital resources need to be divided at a high level. Things like 'Maize', 'Wheat', and 'Rice' are examples of common crop names.

Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given crops. 

Use `GET /commoncropnames` to find the list of available crops on a server.

inputFields.name: programDbIds
inputFields.description:
A BrAPI Program represents the high level organization or group who is responsible for conducting trials and studies. Things like Breeding Programs and Funded Projects are considered BrAPI Programs. 

Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given programs. 

Use `GET /programs` to find the list of available programs on a server.

inputFields.name: programNames
inputFields.description:
Use this parameter to only return results associated with the given program names. Program names are not required to be unique.

Use `GET /programs` to find the list of available programs on a server.

enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on inline fragments.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on variable definitions.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Introspection defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: 'A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: 'If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: isOneOf
fields.description: This field is considered experimental because it has not yet been ratified in the graphql specification

fields.name: specifiedByUrl
fields.deprecationReason: This legacy name has been replaced by `specifiedByURL`

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given __Type is

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar. 'specifiedByURL' is a valid field

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks the field, argument, input field or enum value as deprecated

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
